result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah Edward Causey

records.addlTxt:
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Final Review.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Micah Edward Causey in court with attorney David Bordow.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Criminal Jury Instruction 2632
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed, Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver

Defendant Micah Edward Causey in court with attorney David Bordow.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. No documents have been efiled. Defense counsel is not ready to proceed again. Court outlines required documents that must be efiled before the next court date. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in branch 21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:50 am.

Court rescheduled upcoming court hearing and notified the parties via email correspondence. Confirmation received by the parties. Next court date is a preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27th, 2022 at 4:00 pm.
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form

Defendant Micah Edward Causey in court with attorney David Bordow.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for preliminary hearing and entry into DPA. Defense counsel is not prepared and requests adjournment. No further adjournments. Court continues to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing and DPA entry in branch 21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed, Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 051083,
Payable Number: 1010057,
Receipt Number: 22RP022005,
Amount: $20.00

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Micah Edward Causey in court with attorney David Bordow.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

Defense counsel was not able to efile documents. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in branch 21.
  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5/27/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
